candidates.title: hyper-rustls 0.25 prep, rustls 0.22 update
candidates.body:
## Description

This branch updates to rustls 0.22 and bumps the crate version from 0.25.0-alpha.0 to 0.25, taking the following associated updates:

* rustls 0.22.0-alpha-6 -> 0.22
* pki-types 0.2 -> 1
* tokio-rustls 0.25.0-alpha.4 -> 0.25
* rustls-native-certs 0.7.0-alpha.3 -> 0.7
* webpki-roots 0.26.0-alpha.2 -> 0.26
* rustls-pemfile 2.0.0-alpha.2 -> 2

Breaking API changes are addressed as required. Notably, the `with_provider_and_webpki_roots` builder fn that accepts a custom provider and uses the safe default protocol versions is now fallible to account for a possible error if the provider's configuration is not compatible.

candidates.title: Update to rustls 0.22.0 alpha.6
candidates.body: Updates to `rustls` 0.22.0-alpha.6, fixes a feature requirement, and adds a ci job to check each feature.

candidates.title: Update hyper to 1.x and integrate with hyper-util
candidates.body:
Since hyper 1.x leaves control of the accepting process to the user ([explanation](https://github.com/rustls/hyper-rustls/pull/232#issuecomment-1879272874)), I removed the acceptor API and server examples.

The tokio feature in hyper-util is required for the IO adapter traits, so the need for a tokio-runtime feature is gone (it was already a hard dependency before).

candidates.title: Prepare 0.24.2 release
candidates.body:
Someone asked for this privately in order to help avoid duplicate dependencies (in particular, webpki-roots).

## Proposed release notes

* Tweak behavior of `enable_all_versions()` based on enabled versions
* Add `AcceptorBuilder::with_acceptor()` builder method

candidates.title: deps: update webpki-roots v0.24 -> 0.25
candidates.body:
This commit updates the optional `webpki-roots` dependency from v0.24 to v0.25.

One breaking change is addressed in `src/config.rs`.

Replaces https://github.com/rustls/hyper-rustls/pull/214

candidates.title: Disable unnecessary default features from futures-util
candidates.body: futures-util recently grew some more dependencies (via futures-macros) which we don't need here.

candidates.title: Update webpki-roots requirement from 0.23 to 0.24

candidates.body:
Fixes #209.

- [x] Wrote release notes ([draft](https://github.com/rustls/hyper-rustls/releases/edit/untagged-8834ee1cac69f975f112))

- [x] Checked that all dependencies are up to date
- [x] Tests are passing locally with `--all-features` and updated dependencies
- [x] Bumped version in `Cargo.toml`
- [x] Published with `--dry-run`

Update repo URL and use SPDX license format
hyper-rustls v0.24.0 w/ rustls 0.21.0 + tokio-rustls 0.24.0
candidates.body:
## Description

This branch updates hyper-rustls to use a patch to track the yet-to-be-released 0.21.0 rustls work, both as a direct dependency and through an upgrade to tokio-rustls v0.24.0. 

## Remaining work

- [X] wait for https://github.com/tokio-rs/tls/pull/137 to be merged
- [x] wait for tokio-rustls v0.24.0 to be published to crates.io
- [x] remove Cargo.toml patch for tokio-rustls
- [x] get PR approved
- [x] publish 0.24.0

candidates.title: Add TLSAcceptor and Builder
candidates.body: TLSAcceptor, including a builder, also adds a `builder()` method to the Connector for convenience.

candidates.title: Rustls 0.20 and HttpsConnectorBuilder
candidates.body:
This upgrades rustls to 0.20 (pending a release of rustls-native-certs), and ports the HttpsConnectorBuilder in #145 to something more like rustls' new [ConfigBuilder](https://docs.rs/rustls/0.20.0/rustls/struct.ConfigBuilder.html) (typestate based).

Parts of the rustls 0.20 work were taken from #153.

candidates.title: Use server example based on warp tls
candidates.body:
The current server example is not able to process another request
while tls is resolving the cert, which prevents acme client from
solving acme tls challenges, similarly during that all other
requests will be blocked. Although I am not quite sure why but
the tls in warp worked out for me.

I forgot what I changed but I recall I was trying testing out with the new resolver but I wonder why it can't seemed to receive challenge request from acme, then I noticed that it can't even receive requests from another curl client, then I found the issue out.

candidates.title: fix: Only report http2 support if the http2 feature is enabled

chosen_pr.title: Update hyper to 1.x and integrate with hyper-util
chosen_pr.body:
Since hyper 1.x leaves control of the accepting process to the user ([explanation](https://github.com/rustls/hyper-rustls/pull/232#issuecomment-1879272874)), I removed the acceptor API and server examples.

The tokio feature in hyper-util is required for the IO adapter traits, so the need for a tokio-runtime feature is gone (it was already a hard dependency before).

chosen_detail.title: Update hyper to 1.x and integrate with hyper-util
chosen_detail.body:
Since hyper 1.x leaves control of the accepting process to the user ([explanation](https://github.com/rustls/hyper-rustls/pull/232#issuecomment-1879272874)), I removed the acceptor API and server examples.

The tokio feature in hyper-util is required for the IO adapter traits, so the need for a tokio-runtime feature is gone (it was already a hard dependency before).
